intro: Cuphea longiflora f. major, commonly known as the showy cuphea, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It is characterized by its striking, tubular red or orange flowers that bloom in clusters, attracting pollinators such as hummingbirds and bees. The plant has narrow, lance-shaped leaves and thrives in full sun to partial shade. It is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its vibrant blooms and compact growth habit. Botanically, it belongs to the Lythraceae family, which includes other flowering plants with showy inflorescences.
